sen.j: 広橋 国光（ひろはし くにみつ、大永6年5月19日 (旧暦)（1526年7月8日） - 永禄11年11月12日 (旧暦)（1568年12月10日））は戦国時代 (日本)、安土桃山時代の公家。
sen.e: Kunimitsu HIROHASHI (July 8, 1526 - December 10, 1568) was a Court noble of the Sengoku period (Japan) and the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Kunimitsu HIROHASHI (July 8, 1526 - December 10, 1568) was a Court noble during the Sengoku period (Japan) and the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: rewording
sen.e: Kunimitsu HIROHASHI (July 8, 1526 - December 10, 1568) was a Court noble during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) and the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 藤原北家日野氏流、家格は名家 (公家)で、広橋兼秀の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Kanehide HIROHASHI, descended from Hino line of the House of Fujiwara North, and his Kakaku (family status) was rated as an important family (Court noble).
He was a son of Kanehide HIROHASHI, who belonged to the Hino line of the House of Fujiwara North, and whose Kakaku (family status) was rated as an distinguished family (member of the Court noble).
sen.cmt: rewording
sen.e: He belonged to the Hino line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, his kakaku (family status) was rated as an distinguished family (member of the Court noble), and a son of Kanehide HIROHASHI.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Masaaki KAJUJI.
His mother was a daughter of Masaaki KAJUJI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Masaaki KAJUJI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Nagaie TAKAKURA.
His wife was a daughter of Nagaie TAKAKURA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Nagaie TAKAKURA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子に広橋兼勝、日野輝資、日禎（本圀寺16世、常寂光寺開山。）。
sen.e: His children were Kanekatsu HIROHASHI, Terusuke HINO, Nisshin (16th chief priest of Honkoku-ji Temple, founder of Jojakko-ji Temple as the first chief priest).
His children were Kanekatsu HIROHASHI, Terusuke HINO, Nisshin (16th Chief Priest of Honkoku-ji Temple and Firt Chief Priest and Founder of Jojakko-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: rewording
sen.e: His children included Kanekatsu HIROHASHI, Terusuke HINO, Nisshin (16th Chief Priest of Honkoku-ji Temple and First Chief Priest and Founder of Jojakko-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: スペル修正などしました。

sen.e: His pseudonym was 後引接院.
sen.cmt: 「後引接院」の読み方がわかりません。
sen.e: He called himself 後引接院.
sen.cmt: the reading of 後引接院 is not provided
sen.e: He called himself Goinjoin (後引接院).
sen.cmt: 推測される読みを補足しました。

sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Sonjaku.
sen.cmt: 「尊寂」の読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Sonjaku.
sen.cmt: the reading of 尊寂 is not certain
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Sonjaku (尊寂).
sen.cmt: 読み不明の漢字を補足しました。

sen.j: 官位は正二位権大納言。
sen.e: His official rank was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
His official rank was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His official rank was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.e: He served Emperor Ogimachi.
He served Emperor Ogimachi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He served Emperor Ogimachi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
